sentence.Network_en: The subject makes her writhe with embarrassment.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个话题让她难堪得坐立不安。

sentence.Network_cn: 他茫然地盯着仍在翻滚缠绕的鳗鱼。

sentence.Network_en: Though the thought made her writhe, there was nothing she could do about it.

list.abs: ...空间里双螺旋的长轴经常重复地自我交叉(这种交叉的次数即为缠绕数)这种因外力造成的扭曲最形象化的例子是过度扭曲的电话线。缠绕分为两种形式、一种形式称为互卷(interwound)或相缠螺旋(plectonemic writhe)，另一种形式为环形(toroid)或螺线管状(spiral)。相缠螺旋形式和螺旋管形式是cccDNA拓扑等价的几何特性，容易发生相互转化。缠绕数是cccDNA中相缠螺旋形式缠绕数和螺线管形式缠绕.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wrīthan 'make into coils, plait, fasten with a cord', of Germanic origin; related to wreathe

entry.tran: (通常指由于剧痛或不适而)扭动，翻滚
entry.def: If you writhe, your body twists and turns violently backwards and forwards, usually because you are in great pain or discomfort.

example.ex: The subject makes her writhe with embarrassment...
example.tran: 这个话题让她难堪得坐立不安。

means.word_mean: 1. to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling);

sentences.sentence: "The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace"
